document.masterDocTitle: Bees of the genus Anthidium Fabricius, 1804 (Hymenoptera: Apoidea: Megachilidae: Anthidiini) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Bees of the genus Anthidium Fabricius, 1804 (Hymenoptera: Apoidea: Megachilidae: Anthidiini) from China

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 7.
Anthidium ( Anthidium ) florentinum ( Fabricius, 1775 )
. Female. a: Body in lateral view; b: Head in frontal view; c: Mandible in lateral view; d: Mesosoma in dorsal view; e: Metasoma in dorsal view; f: T4–T6 in dorsal view. Scale bars: 1 mm.

FIGURE 8.
Anthidium ( Anthidium ) florentinum ( Fabricius, 1775 )
. Male. a: Body in lateral view; b: Head in frontal view; c: Clypeus in frontal view; d: Mesosoma in dorsal view; e: Metasoma in dorsal view; f: T5–T7 in dorsal view; g: S7 in ventral view; h: S8 in ventral view; i: Genitalia in dorsal view; j: Genitalia in lateral view. Scale bars: 1 mm.

FIGURE 9.
Anthidium ( Anthidium ) helianthinum Wu, 2004
. Female (Holotype). a: Body in lateral view; b: Head in frontal view; c: Mandible in lateral view; d: Mesosoma in dorsal view; e: Metasoma in dorsal view; f: T3–T6 in dorsal view; g: Type label information. Scale bars: 1 mm.

FIGURE 10.
Anthidium ( Anthidium ) helianthinum Wu, 2004
. Male (Paratype). a: Body in lateral view; b: Head in frontal view; c: Mesosoma in dorsal view; d: Metasoma in dorsal view; e: T7 in dorsal view; f: Genitalia in dorsal view; g: S7 in ventral view; h: S8 in ventral view; i: S6 in ventral view; j: Type label information. Scale bars: 1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution: Widespread in the Palaearctic from North Africa and Portugal to China and Russia , adventive in Canada . China ( Jiangsu *, Inner Mongolia , Xinjiang , Gansu , Sichuan ); Morocco , Algeria , Malta , Spain , Portugal , France , Germany , Switzerland , Italy , Slovakia , Hungary , Albania , Romania , Bulgaria , Slovenia , Croatia , Bosnia and Herzegovina , Serbia , Montenegro , North Macedonia, Greece , Ukraine , Turkey , Cyprus , Syria , Lebanon , Israel , Georgia , Azerbaijan , Iran , Kazakhstan , Kyrgyzstan (Jalal-Abad; Ysyk-Köl), Tajikistan , Uzbekistan , Turkmenistan , Pakistan , Afghanistan , Russia (North Caucasus, European part, Siberia, Far East), Canada (Southern Quebec ).

Floral association:
Vicia
sp.,
Genista
sp.,
Medicago
sp.,
Astragalus
sp.,
Melilotus
sp.,
Onobrychis viciifolia
( Fabaceae ),
Lamium
sp.,
Leonurus
sp.,
Mentha
sp.,
Hyssopus
sp. ( Lamiaceae ) ( Banaszak & Romasenko, 1998 ;
Nadimi et al. , 2014
;
Murao et al. , 2015
; Wu, 2006 ),
Chamaenerion angustifolium
( Onagraceae ),
Hedysarum mon- golicum
(Leguminosae),
Helianthus annuus
( Asteraceae ) ( Wu, 2006 );
Apocynum venetum
( Apocynaceae ).

Remarks: Wu (2006) misidentified the specimen from “ China , Inner Mongolia : Alxa Meng, Ejin Qi ( 41º54′N , 101º00′E ), 1 ♀ , 8.VIII.1987 , leg. Zhu-Zhu ZHANG” as
A. ( A. ) manicatum ( Linnaeus, 1758 )
. Wu (2004) published
A. ( P. ) heliahthinum Wu, 2004
; Wu (2004 , 2006 ) described the female mandible with six teeth, but by examination of the holotype , the mandible has five teeth ( Fig. 9c ); furthermore, the male T7, the male genitalia showed in Figs of Wu (2004 , 2006 ) are different from those from the male paratype . Characters of A
A. ( P. ) heliahthinum Wu, 2004
are the same with those of
A. florentinum ( Fabricius, 1775 )
, so
A. ( P. ) heliahthinum Wu, 2004
is a new synonym of
A. florentinum ( Fabricius, 1775 )
.

Bees from the Caucasus and elsewhere in the eastern portion of the range tend to have more extensive yellow markings and have often been recognized as subspecies
Anthidium ( A. ) f. caucasicum Radoszkowski
, but coloration varies both within and between sites so we prefer to treat it as a junior synonym following Warncke (1980) . The taxonomic relevance of color variation in this and other
Anthidium
requires further study including both detailed morphological analyses (as has been done for other anthidiines, see Kasparek, 2020 ) and molecuar diagnostics.
